cta.text: Need to modernize a storefront without starting over? Let’s map a path.

oneLiner: Headless e‑commerce front‑end that moved a sales‑led model toward organic online orders.
problem: The existing theme wasn’t built for a modern component approach. We needed a cleaner architecture and a path off the template system without breaking the business.
scope: Integrated Vue into BigCommerce’s Stencil theme
Migrated to a headless front‑end (Vue 3 / Nuxt 3)
Styled with TailwindCSS and wired to platform APIs
decisions: Went headless to keep the UI fast and the integration straightforward
Planned an incremental migration so the site could keep selling
Kept the stack simple—fewer moving parts, easier to hand off
outcome: Enabled a shift from purely salesperson‑driven orders to organic online sales.
notes: My biggest takeaway from this project was just how much I appreciated Typescript. The experience of going from a TS project to plain ol' Javascript really enforced how valuable developer experience is to moving a project forward and collaborating with your teammates.
